page.title: 17ECOLOGY EGMANTON/LAXTON
page.content: The ecology of this lowland area is closely associated with the heavy clay soils of the Triassic Keuper Marl. Though large tracts are farmed, important and varied habitats remain. Woodland is represented by Egmanton and Lady Wood. These are isolated sanctuaries, surrounded by arable land, and hedgerows radiating from these form important lines of communication where many species find food and shelter. Grassland species flourish along green lanes and roadside verges. Gardens, orchards and farm buildings provide habitats for birds and insects. Running through Egmanton is a clear unpolluted beck in an otherwise rather dry area.
